intro: Centrostachys canescens, commonly known as the silverleaf centrostachys, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-like flower clusters. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
